name: dislodgement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the action of something moving or being removed from a fixed position, for example inside the body: In the event of dislodgement of the tube it must be reinserted. Some of the large rocks are bolted in place, to reduce the risk of dislodgements. Related word
dislodge
More examplesFewer examplesThe most frequent serious complication with catheters is dislodgement.There is a risk of tracheal tube dislodgement going unnoticed.Most dislodgements and infections tended to occur in the 3 months following implantation.
